terms.name: Explorer
terms.description: [this] can move to inactive zones you control.
rulings: It still must be summoned or set to an active zone first.
The zone is still considered inactive.
The card can be targeted by effects or attacks regardless of the activation status of its zone.
An Explorer card in an inactive zone can later move again and switch places with another card without Explorer, leaving the later in an inactive zone.

terms.name: Move
terms.description: Perform the [[Move Action]].

terms.name: Maneuver
terms.description: Move target artifact as if it had Movement equal to at least this card's Movement.
rulings: This is considered a Move Action being performed by the artifact (but does not consume their turn's Action).
If the artifact already has more Movement than [this], you can use the greater number.
[this] does not need to connect to the destination zone.
You can switch with another artifact.
You _can_ move a face-down artifact (always use [this] Movement stat in this case).

If you exceed the [[Soulrift]] cost, you are still susceptible to [[Soulburn]].
If this has Soul counters due to the [[Reap]] action, those are still released upon destruction.

terms.name: Convoke
terms.description:
[[Soul | Soulrift]] X (up to 3): depending on the chosen value of X, summon face-up on target empty creature zone:

- 1: a Creature Token
- 2: a creature from your hand (you must pay its Summoning Cost)
- 3: an Ally creature from your Extra Deck (you must pay its Summoning Cost but not Rift opening costs)
rulings: This action is only available for creatures.
You _can_ sacrifice [this] as part of the cost (but you cannot choose [this] zone for the summon).
You do not need to pay any additional Soulrift costs to open a Rift for accessing your extra deck.

effects.desc: If target card activates an Activation effect; pay 3 life: select a different Activation effect from any card on the field; resolve that effect instead, ignoring costs.

If target card activates an effect: modify any one number from the resolution portion of the effect text by one (note: you cannot change sign but you can go to zero), and resolve the new version instead.
If you are dealt damage by your opponent: all damage dealt to you by your opponent this chain is dealt to your opponent instead, and vice-versa (note: this does not include paying costs.).
If target creature is dealt X damage: you gain X life instead.
If target creature battles: that creature gets +2 Attack until end of turn.
If target creature battles: that creature gets +2 Armor until end of turn.
If target creature battles: that creature gets +2 Life until end of turn.
If target creature would be summoned to target zone: set that creature instead (note: this includes flips).
If target creature would activate an Activation effect; pay 2 life: flip that creature face-down instead.
If target creature would perform an Action; pay 3 life: flip that creature face-down instead.
If target creature declares an Attack Action: choose a new valid target for that attack.
If target creature activates an effect that targets one card: choose a new valid target for that effect.
Choose one card you control and one card your opponent controls: add 1 mana to each.

terms.description: All arrows in [this] are considered to be single arrows for the duration.

terms.name: Wake
terms.description: Flip target creature; its controller gain 1 life.
rulings: Target creature must be face-down in order to be flipped.
The controller gains 1 life only if the creature is flipped.
The controller gains 1 life before any When flipped/When summoned effects but after Shadowwalker.

terms.name: Maneuver
terms.description: Move target artifact as if it had Movement equal to at least this card's Movement.
rulings: This is considered a Move Action being performed by the artifact (but does not consume their turn's Action).
If the artifact already has more Movement than [this], you can use the greater number.
[this] does not need to connect to the destination zone.
You can switch with another artifact.
You _can_ move a face-down artifact (always use [this] Movement stat in this case).

name: Elder Sage of the Mountaintop
flavor: He had been there for as long as anyone could remember, but you just _had_ to Rift Summon him.

effects.desc: Transfer 1 mana from [this] to target card, or vice-versa.

terms.name: Convoke
terms.description:
[[Soul | Soulrift]] X (up to 3): depending on the chosen value of X, summon face-up on target empty creature zone:

- 1: a Creature Token
- 2: a creature from your hand (you must pay its Summoning Cost)
- 3: an Ally creature from your Extra Deck (you must pay its Summoning Cost but not Rift opening costs)
rulings: This action is only available for creatures.
You _can_ sacrifice [this] as part of the cost (but you cannot choose [this] zone for the summon).
You do not need to pay any additional Soulrift costs to open a Rift for accessing your extra deck.

terms.name: Conscript
terms.description: Summon a [[Creature Token]] to target empty active creature zone.
rulings: This action is only available for creatures.
The Creature Token must be face-up (you can choose the orientation).
If the zone is no longer empty when this effect resolves: it fizzles.

rulings: This action is only available for creatures.

terms.name: Reap
terms.description: Take a Rank 0 [[Soul]] from the [[Aether]] and put it on [this].
rulings: This action is only available for creatures.
Players can Soulrift using Souls on cards you control as if they were in the Aether.
If a card with Souls is destroyed, return those Souls to the Aether.
If a creature holding Souls is destroyed, the Souls stored and a new Soul associated with its destruction are all returned to the Aether.

effects.desc: Choose any three costs: (1) Soulrift 2; (2) sac 2 creatures; (3) consume any 2 mana; or (4) discard 2 cards: summon.

terms.name: Explorer
terms.description: [this] can move to inactive zones you control.
rulings: It still must be summoned or set to an active zone first.
The zone is still considered inactive.
The card can be targeted by effects or attacks regardless of the activation status of its zone.
An Explorer card in an inactive zone can later move again and switch places with another card without Explorer, leaving the later in an inactive zone.
